cyclone.name: ROSA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 mi WSW of Punta Eugenia, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northeast toward the central/northern Baja California peninsula, then across the northern Gulf of California and into the U.S. Desert Southwest
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central-northern Baja California peninsula near Punta Eugenia

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Baja California from Bahia de los Angeles to San Felipe (T.S. Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: West coast of Baja California from Punta Abreojos to Cabo San Quintin (T.S. Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Baja California peninsula coasts, Gulf of California shoreline, southern California coast (including San Diego) affected by large swells and rain
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible; chance of sustained tropical-storm force winds <5%
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected, but large surf and rip currents likely
weather_observation.rainfall: Rainfall of 1â€“2 inches (isolated 3 inches) possible Monday night through Tuesday, causing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, minor coastal flooding possible during high tides
